1.text: If therefore ye be risen with Christ, seek things above, where Christ is sitting on the right hand of God.

2.text: Think of things above, and not upon those upon the earth.

3.text: For ye died, and your life has been hid with Christ in God.

4.text: When Christ shall be manifested, our life, then also ye with him shall be made manifest in glory.

5.text: Therefore kill your members that are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry:

6.text: For these comes the Wrath of God upon the sons of disobedience:

7.text: In which also ye then walked, when ye lived in them.

8.text: And now ye also put them all away; anger, wrath, badness, slander, shameful language out of your mouth.

9.text: Lie not to one another, having put off the old man with big deeds;

10.text: And having put on the new, being renewed in knowledge according to the image of him having created him:

11.text: Where no Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, foreigner, Scythian, servant, free: but Christ all things, and in all.

12.text: Put on therefore, as the chosen of God, holy and beloved, bowels of compassions, kindnesses, humility, meekness, longsuffering;

13.text: (Bearing one another, propitiating one another, if any have a complaint against any: as also Christ propitiated for you, so also ye.)

14.text: And over all these, love, which is the bond of completion.

15.text: And let the peace of God act as umpire in your hearts, to which also, ye were called in one body: and be grateful.

16.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in, you richly; teaching and reminding one another in all wisdom, playing with harps, and songs, and spiritual odes, with grace singing in your hearts to the Lord.

17.text: And all whatever you do in word and in work, all things in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

18.text: Women, place yourselves under your own husbands, as was permitted in the Lord.

19.text: Men, love ye the wives, and be not embittered against them.

20.text: Children, listen to parents in all things: for this is pleasing to the Lord.

21.text: Fathers, irritate not your children, lest they be discouraged.

22.text: Servants, listen ye in all things to lords according to the flesh; not in eyeservice as pleasing men; but in simplicity of heart, fearing God:

23.text: And all, whatever ye do, work ye from the soul, as to the Lord, and not to men;

24.text: Knowing that from the Lord ye shall receive the reward of inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.

25.text: And he acting with injustice shall be taken care of for what he did unjustly: and there is no distinction of persons.
